item.title: Emacs Windows Installation
item.description:
Problems with installing

  1. Not having msys2 so that pdftools can’t build [install msys]

  2. Not having mingw so that sqlite can’t build for org-roam [choco install mingw] Don’t even have to do that. The mingw is installed by msys2. So go to mysys2: there will be folder named mingw64. Add it’s bin to the PATH.

       pacman -Syu
   pacman -S base-devel
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-toolchain
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-zlib
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-libpng
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-poppler
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-imagemagick

  3. Then find a version that supports modules : emax64. This is a well off version and has binaries in different places and things like that because it tries providing it’s own configuration.

item.title: Subconscious Reprogramming
item.description:
Link:How To Reprogram Subconscious Mind: The one cycle that determines your fate (Dirty Secret) - YouTube - Brave

Overall flow:

Thoughts[Incoming/Outgoing] –> Emotion Emotions –> Belief Belief –> RAS ( Reticular Activating System ) RAS –> Confirmation Confirmation –> Conviction

  1. Thoughts and emotions switch between each other for some time to form belief. You don’t choose incoming thoughts: these happen and most of us subconsciously create emotion out of it; then switch back and forth between more thoughts and more emotions.
  2. Confirmation is when you search for more proof to confirm your belief that you made.
  3. Strong proofs lead to conviction.

We have a habit of getting stuck in convictions. Even if we want to change conviction we cannot for most of the time. So, we need to break the whole cycle to break or change a conviction that we have.

item.title: Practical Guide to Debating
item.description:
• Page 16 Highlight: “Anticipating and engaging with a multiplicity of views are required.”

  • Page 19 Highlight:

    Speaking —talking out loud fluently and without hesitation Arguing —condensing what you say into a persuasive point(s) Listening —hearing and understanding the points others make Synthesizing —matching the points you and others make Arranging —structuring your points into a persuasive speec

  • Page 19 Highlight: “Switch”

  • Page 19 Highlight:

    Excellent listening skills are needed to follow the thread of an argument and be able to continue it without pause;

item.title: Emacs Windows Installation
item.description:
Problems with installing

  1. Not having msys2 so that pdftools can’t build [install msys]

  2. Not having mingw so that sqlite can’t build for org-roam [choco install mingw] Don’t even have to do that. The mingw is installed by msys2. So go to mysys2: there will be folder named mingw64. Add it’s bin to the PATH.

       pacman -Syu
   pacman -S base-devel
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-toolchain
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-zlib
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-libpng
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-poppler
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-imagemagick

  3. Then find a version that supports modules : emax64. This is a well off version and has binaries in different places and things like that because it tries providing it’s own configuration.
